channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Jury finds 3 former Memphis police officers not guilty in death of Tyre Nichols
item.description: A jury has found three former Memphis police officers not guilty in the death of Tyre Nichols.

item.title: In Atlanta, CDC staff reel after recent cuts
item.description: The CDC has lost thousands of workers since January. At a conference celebrating the work of the agency's "disease detectives," current and former staff grappled with uncertainty about the future.

item.title: A controversial experiment on Reddit reveals the persuasive powers of AI
item.description: Researchers at the University of Zurich wanted to see how persuasive AI could be -- but did not get permission to do research on the actual humans on Reddit that the AI was interacting with.

item.title: Faulty DNA tests lead to more than 1, 000 criminal cases across Texas being reviewed
item.description: Faulty DNA tests being used in criminal cases in Texas could impact more than 1,000 cases. Under some circumstances, these tests were incorrectly coming back as insufficient DNA to test.

item.title: Why a group of vets and lawmakers want to legalize a plant-derived drug to treat PTSD
item.description: A group of U.S. vets and lawmakers are leading an effort to get clinical trials up and running in for a potent psychoactive drug called Ibogaine.

item.title: Can the new pope inspire young Catholics?
item.description: How are young Catholics thinking about the American Catholic church during the papal transition. NPR's Scott Detrow speaks to the hosts of American Magazine's Jesuitical podcast.

item.title: Trump's tariffs are showing up in Americans' receipts
item.description: Small businesses are scrambling to figure out the cost of tariffs. Most are passing on some of the cost to American customers.

item.title: America's air traffic control problem
item.description: David Grizzle, the Chief Operating Officer and head of air traffic control for the FAA during the Obama administration, talks about current air traffic issues.

item.title: The papal conclave opens
item.description: The papal conclave is underway at the Vatican. NPR religion correspondent breaks down what's happening.

item.title: Need help switching appliances from gas to electric? These 'coaches' can help
item.description: Government incentives for climate-friendly upgrades are confusing to navigate and it can be hard to find businesses that sell them, so a new industry is emerging to help: the decarbonization coach.
